ul.li1: 1How the gold has grown dim,
the pure gold has changed.
The stones of holiness are scattered
ul.li2: at the head of every street.
ul.li1: 2The precious sons of Zion
ul.li2: weighed against fine gold,
ul.li1: how they are thought of as earthen vessels of clay,
ul.li2: the work of the potter’s hands.
ul.li1: 3Even the jackal bears the beast
ul.li2: and nurses their cubs;
ul.li1: but the daughter of my people has become ruthless,
ul.li2: like ostriches in the wilderness.
ul.li1: 4The tongue of the nursling cleaves
ul.li2: to its palate in thirst.
ul.li1: Children beg for food,
ul.li2: no one lays it out before them.Literally “nothing spreads to them”
ul.li1: 5The ones who eat delicacies,
ul.li2: they are ruined in the streets;
ul.li1: the ones nurtured in purple
ul.li2: lie on piles of trash.
ul.li1: 6The iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater
ul.li2: than the sin of Sodom;
ul.li1: it was overthrown in a moment
ul.li2: and no hands were laid on her.
ul.li1: 7Her princes were purer than snow,
ul.li2: they were whiter than milk;
ul.li1: their bodies were more ruddy than rubies,
ul.li2: sapphire their appearance.
ul.li1: 8Now their appearance is blacker than soot,
ul.li2: they are not recognized in the streets;
ul.li1: their skin has shriveled on their bones,
ul.li2: it has become dry like wood.
ul.li1: 9Happier were the victims of the sword
ul.li2: than the victims of famine;
ul.li1: they have pined away, very hungry
ul.li2: for the crops of my field.
ul.li1: 10The hands of compassionate women,
ul.li2: have cooked their children;
ul.li1: they became as something to eat
ul.li2: in the destruction of the daughter of my people.
ul.li1: 11Yahweh has completed his anger,
ul.li2: he has poured out his fierce anger;Literally “the fierce anger of his nose”
ul.li1: he has kindled a fire in Zion,
ul.li2: it consumed herOr “its” foundations.
ul.li1: 12The kings of the earth did not believe,
ul.li2: and all the inhabitants of the world,
ul.li1: that a foe and an enemy could enter
ul.li2: into the gates of Jerusalem.
ul.li1: 13Because of the sins of her prophets,
ul.li2: the guilt of her priests,
ul.li1: who shed blood in her midst,
ul.li2: of righteous people.
ul.li1: 14They wander blindly in the streets;
ul.li2: they were defiled with the blood,
ul.li1: their clothes
ul.li2: could not be touched.
ul.li1: 15“Go away! Defiled!” they shout to them.
ul.li2: “Go away! Go away! Do not touch!”
ul.li1: so they left, they left; it was said among the nations,
ul.li2: “They will no longer dwell with us.”Literally “They will no longer be here as aliens”
ul.li1: 16The presence of Yahweh has scattered them,
ul.li2: he will no longer watch over them;
ul.li1: they did not honor the priests,Literally “they did not lift up the faces of the priests”
ul.li2: they did not show mercy to elders.
ul.li1: 17Still our eyes failed,
ul.li2: looking for our help in vain;
ul.li1: in our watchtower, we kept watch
ul.li2: for a nation that could not save.
ul.li1: 18They hunted our steps,
ul.li2: from walking in our streets;
ul.li1: our end has come near, our days are finished,Literally “our days are filled”
ul.li2: our end has come.
ul.li1: 19Our pursuers were swifter
ul.li2: than the eagles of the heavens;
ul.li1: they chased us on the mountains,
ul.li2: they have set an ambush for us in the desert.
ul.li1: 20The breath of our nostrils, the anointed one of Yahweh,
ul.li2: was captured in their pits;
ul.li1: of whom we said, “In his shadow
ul.li2: we will live among the nations.”
ul.li1: 21Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom,
ul.li2: you who dwell in the land of Uz;
ul.li1: but to you also the cup will pass,
ul.li2: you will become drunk and strip yourself bare.
ul.li1: 22The punishment of your iniquity is completed, O daughter of Zion,
ul.li2: your exile will not continue;
ul.li1: but he will punish your iniquity, O daughter of Edom,
ul.li2: he will reveal your sins.
